definition: pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

pinyin: du2 li4 Zhong1 wen2 bi3 hui4

sentences.english: However, if the information icon is ineffective, then the Pen Reader will sound only one long warning signal.
sentences.chinese: 如果信息圖標無效，識別筆會發出一長聲警報音。

sentences.english: The participants can either may engage in joint creation or improvise on the spot.
sentences.chinese: 書畫筆會可聯合創作或即席揮毫。

definition: both the guests and the hosts thoroughly enjoy themselves (idiom)
to write or draw with a brush/to put pen to paper/to write
Nü Shu writing, a phonetic syllabary for Yao ethnic group 瑶族 瑤族 dialect designed and used by women in Jiangyong county 江永縣|江永县 in southern Hunan
the Three Su father and sons (referring to Northern Song literati Su Xun 蘇洵|苏洵[Su1 Xun2], Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼[Su1 Shi4] and Su Zhe 蘇轍|苏辙[Su1 Zhe2])
to pass on the light of Buddha
Chunri or Chunjih township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
variant of 嘉賓|嘉宾[jia1 bin1]
